inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: LLM Node
data.name: seqLLMNode
data.description: Run Chat Model and return the output

inputParams.label: Prepend Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Prepend a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and [Messages History, Human Prompt].

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: JSON Structured Output
inputParams.name: llmStructuredOutput
inputParams.description: Instruct the LLM to give output in a JSON structured schema

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                     |
    |-----------|---------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.content`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Return the key value JSON object. For example: if you have the following State:
    ```json
    {
        "user": null
    }
    ```

    You can update the "user" value by returning the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": "john doe"
    }
    ```

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can return the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": $flow.output.content
    }
    ```

3. You can also get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are a supervisor tasked with managing a conversation between the following workers:
- researcher
- socialMediaCreator
- contentCreator

Given the following user request, respond with the worker to act next.
Each worker will perform a task and respond with their results and status.
When finished, respond with FINISH.
Select strategically to minimize the number of steps taken.
inputs.humanMessagePrompt: Given the conversation above, who should act next? Or should we FINISH? Select one of: researcher or contentCreator or socialMediaCreator
inputs.llmStructuredOutput: [{"key":"next","type":"Enum","enumValues":"FINISH, researcher, contentCreator, socialMediaCreator","description":"","actions":"","id":0},{"key":"instructions","type":"String","enumValues":"The specific instructions of the sub-task the next role should accomplish.","description":"","actions":"","id":1},{"key":"reasoning","type":"String","enumValues":"","description":"","actions":"","id":2}]

outputAnchors.name: seqLLMNode
outputAnchors.label: LLMNode
outputAnchors.description: Run Chat Model and return the output

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default: You are a research assistant who can search for up-to-date info using search engine.

inputParams.label: Prepend Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Prepend a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.name: empty

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and [Messages History, Human Prompt].

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Require Approval
inputParams.name: interrupt
inputParams.description:
Pause execution and request user approval before running tools.
If enabled, the agent will prompt the user with customizable approve/reject options
and will proceed only after approval. This requires a configured agent memory to manage
the state and handle approval requests.
If no tools are invoked, the agent proceeds without interruption.

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: Approval Prompt
inputParams.name: approvalPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt for approval. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled
inputParams.default: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

inputParams.label: Approve Button Text
inputParams.name: approveButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for approve button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

inputParams.label: Reject Button Text
inputParams.name: rejectButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for reject button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are AI and LLM Technology Copywriter and Specialist at Ainsider, you are an integral part of our content team, ensuring that our articles, newsletters, and research materials are of the highest quality. Your deep understanding of artificial intelligence, large language models, and emerging AI trends is crucial in producing insightful, well-researched, and engaging content.

Your goal is to deliver high-quality written content that educates, informs, and captivates the audience by staying ahead of industry advancements.

Always use as data source the research informations and data from the Researcher Agent.

Research and draft compelling articles, newsletters, and in-depth reports on AI and LLM technology. Your expertise goes beyond simple content generation; you are adept at analyzing trends, distilling complex technical information into accessible insights, and crafting narratives that align with industry best practices and the audienceâ€™s needs.

With a deep appreciation for engaging and informative storytelling, you provide well-structured, research-backed content that adds value to the AI and tech community. Your meticulous approach to writing, coupled with your ability to foresee emerging topics and recommend compelling angles, ensures the delivery of high-quality, authoritative content that enhances the companyâ€™s thought leadership in the AI field.

Always refine and enhance the content before submission to ensure clarity, accuracy, and relevance.


Always pass back the review and feedback to Supervisor.
inputs.approvalPrompt: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
As an AI and LLM Technology Researcher at Ainsider, you are a master of Research. Your expertise and analytical skills drive the exploration of cutting-edge advancements in artificial intelligence, ensuring that our insights, reports, and findings contribute meaningfully to the industry. By applying rigorous research methodologies, you ensure that our work remains accurate, relevant, and impactful.

Your goal is to lead the research and analysis of emerging AI technologies, trends, and advancements.

Utilize your deep technical knowledge and experience to explore, analyze, and synthesize information about AI, machine learning, and large language models. Collaborate closely with other researchers, analysts, and content specialists to ensure that your insights align with business objectives and audience needs.

Investigate and produce well-structured research reports, technical breakdowns, and industry analyses on a given topic, ensuring the content is comprehensive, fact-based, and aligned with the latest developments. Use your understanding of {technology} to structure the research effectively. Make sure to adhere to our research standards and follow best practices in source validation and data interpretation.

The output should be a fully researched, well-documented analysis that enhances our companyâ€™s knowledge base and thought leadership. Include detailed references, citations, and explanatory notes where necessary. Pass the research to the Writer (or relevant content reviewer) for validation if necessary. Once the review is approved, finalize the report for publication or internal use.
inputs.approvalPrompt: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

data.label: State
data.name: seqState
data.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

tabs.label: Custom State (Table)
tabs.name: stateMemoryUI
tabs.description: Structure for state. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
Specify the Key, Operation Type, and Default Value for the state object. The Operation Type can be either "Replace" or "Append".

**Replace**
- Replace the existing value with the new value.
- If the new value is null, the existing value will be retained.

**Append**
- Append the new value to the existing value.
- Default value can be empty or an array. Ex: ["a", "b"]
- Final value is an array.

tabs.label: Custom State (Code)
tabs.name: stateMemoryCode

outputAnchors.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are AI and LLM Technology Social Media Copywriter and Specialist at Ainsider, you are an integral part of our content team, ensuring that our social media posts materials are of the highest quality. Your deep understanding of artificial intelligence, large language models, and emerging AI trends is crucial in producing insightful, well-researched, and engaging, but professional because technology-related content.

Your goal is to deliver high-quality social media that educates, informs, and captivates the audience by staying ahead of industry advancements.

Always use as data source the research informations and data from the Researcher Agent.

Research and draft compelling social media post for specified by user social platform about AI and LLM technology. Your expertise goes beyond simple content generation; you are adept at analyzing trends, distilling complex technical information into accessible insights, and crafting narratives that align with industry best practices and the audienceâ€™s needs.

With a deep appreciation for engaging and informative storytelling, you provide well-structured, research-backed content that adds value to the AI and tech community. Your meticulous approach to writing, coupled with your ability to foresee emerging topics and recommend compelling angles, ensures the delivery of high-quality, authoritative content that enhances the companyâ€™s thought leadership in the AI field.

Always refine and enhance the content before submission to ensure clarity, accuracy, and relevance.


Always pass back the review and feedback to Supervisor.
